Title:
Nigrospora species associated with various hosts from
Shandong Peninsula, China.
Keywords:
Ascomycota; Morphology; Multi-gene phylogeny; New host
records; Xylariales
Abstract:
Nigrospora is a monophyletic genus belonging to
Apiosporaceae. Species in this genus are phytopathogenic, endophytic and
saprobic on different hosts. In the present study, leaf specimens with
disease symptoms were collected from host plants from Shandong
Peninsula, China. The fungal taxa associated with these leaf spots were
studied using morphology and phylogeny based on ITS, TEF1, TUB2 gene
regions. In this paper, we report on the genus Nigrospora with N.
gorlenkoana, N. oryzae, N. osmanthi, N. rubi and N. sphaerica identified
with 13 novel host associations including crops with economic importance
such as bamboo and Chinese rose.
